content: I got this link, "http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090309/ap_on_re_as/as_koreas_tension" from a link another member posted. It seems N. Korea is once again doing some saber rattling. We're spread thin troop wise and funding wise but I very much fear that in the next few years we're going to have to do something about N.Korea. content: quote: Originally posted by ENYVTHS: I knoe that this will p i ss a few people . But what gives the US the power to tell another country that they can not develope a missle........ I think you meant to say, "What give the US the RIGHT..." (right instead of power) yes? It's a good question, but a complex one. There are many variables, not the least of which include the UN and the resolutions that afford countries the right to apply deterrents in respect to its national defense stance. North Korea needs to be nuked off the face of the planet. They are useless except as a threat. What do they contribute to this planet and its inhabitants? Anyone? Bueler? Bueler? Nothing. Absolutely nothing. They are a threat to the security of others and nothing more. What gives a man a right to punish another man's child? Nothing, right? But that doesn't mean you wouldn't stop another man's child from beating the crap out another man's child, including physically restraining him or her. That's where we, the United States, are current at - we are standing in the way of a punk azz bully getting ready to pound on another child. If NK throws a punch, I hope we send a dozen nukes their way and wipe them off the face of the planet. Maybe then Iran will see that we're not kidding around, we're not sending our boys in to die, and we're not taking crap from pathetic little third-world useless wastes of oxygen. We are the baddest Mother F-ers on the block, and when we say 'knock it off,' we mean knock it off. Take your phallic symbol that is your little pea shooter of a missile and cram it up your azz, NK. Or we'll cram a few up there for you. F-ing terrorists. They deserve no rights, no freedoms, no acknowledgment. They are terrorists. They deserve nothing but death and to rot on the ground as the birds eat their eyes out and the maggots come to deliver the final blow and return to earth their wasted body parts. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
quote: Originally posted by ENYVTHS: I knoe that this will p i ss a few people . But what gives the US the power to tell another country that they can not develope a missle........

title: North Korea Threatening Again

content: Yes, something needs to be done. They've gotten too good at pulling our strings. Shame that we weren't able to clean out that boil in the 1950's. Right now there is some uncertainty regarding who is in charge of what - there has been scuttlebutt that the "Dear Leader" as they call him is sick, etc. Military readiness - they may not be the most modern military, but they can still do some damage. Plus consider the damage from anyone in South Korea that is allied with the North. Also, consider this. Right now we are bogged down with military operations in Iraq and Afghanistan. We have plenty of readiness issues as a result. The Red Chinese are probing and looking for excuses to engage in military action over Taiwan to return them to the fold. North Korea starts something, we go to the aid of South Korea. Red China then starts something with regard to Taiwan. At the same time they move forces close to their border with North Korea. We make a mistake, something hits the ground in Red China that shouldn't, and for the first time since the 1940's we find ourselves in a declared war.
reply: Yes, something needs to be done. They've gotten too good at pulling our strings. Shame that we weren't able to clean out that boil in the 1950's. Right now there is some uncertainty regarding who is in charge of what - there has been scuttlebutt that the "Dear Leader" as they call him is sick, etc. Military readiness - they may not be the most modern military, but they can still do some damage. Plus consider the damage from anyone in South Korea that is allied with the North. Also, consider this. Right now we are bogged down with military operations in Iraq and Afghanistan. We have plenty of readiness issues as a result. The Red Chinese are probing and looking for excuses to engage in military action over Taiwan to return them to the fold. North Korea starts something, we go to the aid of South Korea. Red China then starts something with regard to Taiwan. At the same time they move forces close to their border with North Korea. We make a mistake, something hits the ground in Red China that shouldn't, and for the first time since the 1940's we find ourselves in a declared war.
